oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three-page handwritten letter from Ammons to his family. It contains a hand-drawn diagram of the 3rd Platoon's road-clearing operation; the account of a friendly jet dropping bombs very close to a Viet Cong village and very close to his unit as they cleared Highway 13; and Ammon's description of firing his first two rounds of M79 "harrassment fire" at "Charlie."

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher D. Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia in 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970.
